alert.note: Alert for Ashe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 11 at 12:01PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Ashe and Watauga. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring, and streams continue to rise. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1159 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blowing Rock, Todd, Deep Gap, Glendale Springs, Laurel Springs and Fleetwood. In Boone, Deerfield Road and Bamboo Road are closed due to flooding.
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
